place.name: TRUSTHORPE
place.gazetteerText: TRUSTHORPE, a parish in Louth district, Lincoln: on the coast, 6¾ miles NE of Alford r. station. Post town, Alford. Acres, 1,455; of which 85 are water. Real property, £3,136. Pop., 332. Houses, 68. The manor belongs to T. Alcock, Esq. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £500.* Patron, the Rev. H. Owen. The church was rebuilt in 1842. There are two Methodist chapels and a national school. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
